context: [4] The two-way vehicle count during the experiment was 4179 (17:00 to 18:00 h) and 2958 (18:00 to 19:00 h). [1] The results of the BTEX ambient air concentration measurements are given in table 1. [2] The benzene level based on the time period of the study and the ethylbenzene results are semiquantitative because the analyte was detected at a level above the linear response of calibration curve. [1] The detection limits of the assay were estimated at 0.5 ng/ml based on a signal:noise ratio of 3. Precision, estimated using the ratio between D8 toluene:D10 ethylbenzene and D10 ethylbenzene:D10 o-xylene from all samples, was 6.9% RSD and 4.9% RSD respectively. [2] Accuracy at 0.5 ng/ml was +2.3%, âˆ’3.5%, âˆ’5.6%, âˆ’7.5% and âˆ’4.2% for benzene, toluene, ethylbenzene, m/p-xylene and o-xylene, respectively. [3] A GC-MS chromatogram of an exercising subject is shown in fig 1 containing BTEX and deuterated standards. [4] Chromatographic conditions did not allow resolution of m- and p-xylene, and these peak areas were combined.
